questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :


Statement (I) : $\mathrm{SiO}_2$ and $\mathrm{GeO}_2$ are acidic while $\mathrm{SnO}$ and $\mathrm{PbO}$ are amphoteric in nature.


Statement (II) : Allotropic forms of carbon are due to property of catenation and $\mathrm{p} \pi-\mathrm{d} \pi$ bond formation.



In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.C: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.D: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

options.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.D: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).


Assertion (A) : In aqueous solutions $\mathrm{Cr}^{2+}$ is reducing while $\mathrm{Mn}^{3+}$ is oxidising in nature.


Reason (R) :  Extra stability to half filled electronic configuration is observed than incompletely filled electronic configuration.



In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.B: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)
options.C: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)

questions.question_text:
Consider the following redox reaction :


$$
\mathrm{MnO}_4^{-}+\mathrm{H}^{+}+\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4 \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{Mn}^{2+}+\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}+\mathrm{CO}_2
$$



The standard reduction potentials are given as below $\left(\mathrm{E}_{\text {red }}^0\right)$ :


$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathrm{E}_{\mathrm{MnO}_4^{-} / \mathrm{Mn}^{2+}}^{\circ}=+1.51 \mathrm{~V} \\\\
& \mathrm{E}_{\mathrm{CO}_2 / \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4}^{\circ}=-0.49 \mathrm{~V}
\end{aligned}
$$



If the equilibrium constant of the above reaction is given as $\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{eq}}=10^x$, then the value of $x=$ __________ (nearest integer)
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
Consider the following redox reaction :
$$
\mathrm{MnO}_4^{-}+\mathrm{H}^{+}+\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4 \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{Mn}^{2+}+\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}+\mathrm{CO}_2
$$

The standard reduction potentials are given as below $\left(\mathrm{E}_{\text {red }}^0\right)$ :
$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathrm{E}_{\mathrm{MnO}_4^{-} / \mathrm{Mn}^{2+}}^{\circ}=+1.51 \mathrm{~V} \\\\
& \mathrm{E}_{\mathrm{CO}_2 / \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4}^{\circ}=-0.49 \mathrm{~V}
\end{aligned}
$$

If the equilibrium constant of the above reaction is given as $\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{eq}}=10^x$, then the value of $x=$ __________ (nearest integer)

questions.question_text:
Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x-1, x \text { is even, } \\ 2 x, \quad x \text { is odd, }\end{array} x \in \mathbf{N}\right.$.


 If for some $\mathrm{a} \in \mathbf{N}, f(f(f(\mathrm{a})))=21$, then $\lim\limits_{x \rightarrow \mathrm{a}^{-}}\left\{\frac{|x|^3}{\mathrm{a}}-\left[\frac{x}{\mathrm{a}}\right]\right\}$, where $[t]$ denotes the greatest integer less than or equal to $t$, is equal to :
questions.subject: Mathematics

Let $f(x)=\left\{\begin{array}{l}x-1, x \text { is even, } \\ 2 x, \quad x \text { is odd, }\end{array} x \in \mathbf{N}\right.$.
 If for some $\mathrm{a} \in \mathbf{N}, f(f(f(\mathrm{a})))=21$, then $\lim\limits_{x \rightarrow \mathrm{a}^{-}}\left\{\frac{|x|^3}{\mathrm{a}}-\left[\frac{x}{\mathrm{a}}\right]\right\}$, where $[t]$ denotes the greatest integer less than or equal to $t$, is equal to :

questions.question_text: Three points $\mathrm{O}(0,0), \mathrm{P}\left(\mathrm{a}, \mathrm{a}^2\right), \mathrm{Q}\left(-\mathrm{b}, \mathrm{b}^2\right), \mathrm{a}>0, \mathrm{~b}>0$, are on the parabola $y=x^2$. Let $\mathrm{S}_1$ be the area of the region bounded by the line $\mathrm{PQ}$ and the parabola, and $\mathrm{S}_2$ be the area of the triangle $\mathrm{OPQ}$. If the minimum value of $\frac{\mathrm{S}_1}{\mathrm{~S}_2}$ is $\frac{\mathrm{m}}{\mathrm{n}}, \operatorname{gcd}(\mathrm{m}, \mathrm{n})=1$, then $\mathrm{m}+\mathrm{n}$ is equal to __________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Three points $\mathrm{O}(0,0), \mathrm{P}\left(\mathrm{a}, \mathrm{a}^2\right), \mathrm{Q}\left(-\mathrm{b}, \mathrm{b}^2\right), \mathrm{a}>0, \mathrm{~b}>0$, are on the parabola $y=x^2$. Let $\mathrm{S}_1$ be the area of the region bounded by the line $\mathrm{PQ}$ and the parabola, and $\mathrm{S}_2$ be the area of the triangle $\mathrm{OPQ}$. If the minimum value of $\frac{\mathrm{S}_1}{\mathrm{~S}_2}$ is $\frac{\mathrm{m}}{\mathrm{n}}, \operatorname{gcd}(\mathrm{m}, \mathrm{n})=1$, then $\mathrm{m}+\mathrm{n}$ is equal to __________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: The sum of squares of all possible values of $k$, for which area of the region bounded by the parabolas $2 y^2=\mathrm{k} x$ and $\mathrm{ky}^2=2(y-x)$ is maximum, is equal to :

questions.question_text: If $y=\frac{(\sqrt{x}+1)\left(x^2-\sqrt{x}\right)}{x \sqrt{x}+x+\sqrt{x}}+\frac{1}{15}\left(3 \cos ^2 x-5\right) \cos ^3 x$, then $96 y^{\prime}\left(\frac{\pi}{6}\right)$ is equal to :
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If $y=\frac{(\sqrt{x}+1)\left(x^2-\sqrt{x}\right)}{x \sqrt{x}+x+\sqrt{x}}+\frac{1}{15}\left(3 \cos ^2 x-5\right) \cos ^3 x$, then $96 y^{\prime}\left(\frac{\pi}{6}\right)$ is equal to :

questions.question_text: If $\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} y}=\frac{1+x-y^2}{y}, x(1)=1$, then $5 x(2)$ is equal to __________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If $\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} y}=\frac{1+x-y^2}{y}, x(1)=1$, then $5 x(2)$ is equal to __________.

questions.question_text: Let $f:(0, \infty) \rightarrow \mathbf{R}$ and $\mathrm{F}(x)=\int\limits_0^x \mathrm{t} f(\mathrm{t}) \mathrm{dt}$. If $\mathrm{F}\left(x^2\right)=x^4+x^5$, then $\sum\limits_{\mathrm{r}=1}^{12} f\left(\mathrm{r}^2\right)$ is equal to ____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let $f:(0, \infty) \rightarrow \mathbf{R}$ and $\mathrm{F}(x)=\int\limits_0^x \mathrm{t} f(\mathrm{t}) \mathrm{dt}$. If $\mathrm{F}\left(x^2\right)=x^4+x^5$, then $\sum\limits_{\mathrm{r}=1}^{12} f\left(\mathrm{r}^2\right)$ is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text: Let $A B C$ be an isosceles triangle in which $A$ is at $(-1,0), \angle A=\frac{2 \pi}{3}, A B=A C$ and $B$ is on the positve $x$-axis. If $\mathrm{BC}=4 \sqrt{3}$ and the line $\mathrm{BC}$ intersects the line $y=x+3$ at $(\alpha, \beta)$, then $\frac{\beta^4}{\alpha^2}$ is __________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let $A B C$ be an isosceles triangle in which $A$ is at $(-1,0), \angle A=\frac{2 \pi}{3}, A B=A C$ and $B$ is on the positve $x$-axis. If $\mathrm{BC}=4 \sqrt{3}$ and the line $\mathrm{BC}$ intersects the line $y=x+3$ at $(\alpha, \beta)$, then $\frac{\beta^4}{\alpha^2}$ is __________.

questions.question_text: Let $A=I_2-2 M M^T$, where $M$ is a real matrix of order $2 \times 1$ such that the relation $M^T M=I_1$ holds. If $\lambda$ is a real number such that the relation $A X=\lambda X$ holds for some non-zero real matrix $X$ of order $2 \times 1$, then the sum of squares of all possible values of $\lambda$ is equal to __________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let $A=I_2-2 M M^T$, where $M$ is a real matrix of order $2 \times 1$ such that the relation $M^T M=I_1$ holds. If $\lambda$ is a real number such that the relation $A X=\lambda X$ holds for some non-zero real matrix $X$ of order $2 \times 1$, then the sum of squares of all possible values of $\lambda$ is equal to __________.

questions.question_text: Let $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}=\hat{i}+\hat{j}+\hat{k}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}}=-\hat{i}-8 \hat{j}+2 \hat{k}$ and $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}}=4 \hat{i}+\mathrm{c}_2 \hat{j}+\mathrm{c}_3 \hat{k}$ be three vectors such that $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}} \times \overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}=\overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}} \times \overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}$. If the angle between the vector $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}}$ and the vector $3 \hat{i}+4 \hat{j}+\hat{k}$ is $\theta$, then the greatest integer less than or equal to $\tan ^2 \theta$ is _______________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}=\hat{i}+\hat{j}+\hat{k}, \overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}}=-\hat{i}-8 \hat{j}+2 \hat{k}$ and $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}}=4 \hat{i}+\mathrm{c}_2 \hat{j}+\mathrm{c}_3 \hat{k}$ be three vectors such that $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{b}} \times \overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}=\overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}} \times \overrightarrow{\mathrm{a}}$. If the angle between the vector $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{c}}$ and the vector $3 \hat{i}+4 \hat{j}+\hat{k}$ is $\theta$, then the greatest integer less than or equal to $\tan ^2 \theta$ is _______________.

questions.question_text: If three successive terms of a G.P. with common ratio $\mathrm{r}(\mathrm{r}>1)$ are the lengths of the sides of a triangle and $[r]$ denotes the greatest integer less than or equal to $r$, then $3[r]+[-r]$ is equal to _____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If three successive terms of a G.P. with common ratio $\mathrm{r}(\mathrm{r}>1)$ are the lengths of the sides of a triangle and $[r]$ denotes the greatest integer less than or equal to $r$, then $3[r]+[-r]$ is equal to _____________.

questions.question_text: The lines $\mathrm{L}_1, \mathrm{~L}_2, \ldots, \mathrm{L}_{20}$ are distinct. For $\mathrm{n}=1,2,3, \ldots, 10$ all the lines $\mathrm{L}_{2 \mathrm{n}-1}$ are parallel to each other and all the lines $L_{2 n}$ pass through a given point $P$. The maximum number of points of intersection of pairs of lines from the set $\left\{\mathrm{L}_1, \mathrm{~L}_2, \ldots, \mathrm{L}_{20}\right\}$ is equal to ___________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: The lines $\mathrm{L}_1, \mathrm{~L}_2, \ldots, \mathrm{L}_{20}$ are distinct. For $\mathrm{n}=1,2,3, \ldots, 10$ all the lines $\mathrm{L}_{2 \mathrm{n}-1}$ are parallel to each other and all the lines $L_{2 n}$ pass through a given point $P$. The maximum number of points of intersection of pairs of lines from the set $\left\{\mathrm{L}_1, \mathrm{~L}_2, \ldots, \mathrm{L}_{20}\right\}$ is equal to ___________.

questions.question_text:
From the statements given below :


(A) The angular momentum of an electron in $n^{\text {th }}$ orbit is an integral multiple of $\hbar$.


(B) Nuclear forces do not obey inverse square law.


(C) Nuclear forces are spin dependent.


(D) Nuclear forces are central and charge independent.


(E) Stability of nucleus is inversely proportional to the value of packing fraction.



Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
From the statements given below :
(A) The angular momentum of an electron in $n^{\text {th }}$ orbit is an integral multiple of $\hbar$.
(B) Nuclear forces do not obey inverse square law.
(C) Nuclear forces are spin dependent.
(D) Nuclear forces are central and charge independent.
(E) Stability of nucleus is inversely proportional to the value of packing fraction.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.question_text: A body of mass $4 \mathrm{~kg}$ experiences two forces $\vec{F}_1=5 \hat{i}+8 \hat{j}+7 \hat{k}$ and $\overrightarrow{\mathrm{F}}_2=3 \hat{i}-4 \hat{j}-3 \hat{k}$. The acceleration acting on the body is :
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text:
Monochromatic light of frequency $6 \times 10^{14} \mathrm{~Hz}$ is produced by a laser. The power emitted is $2 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{~W}$. 

How many photons per second on an average, are emitted by the source ?


(Given $\mathrm{h}=6.63 \times 10^{-34} \mathrm{Js}$ )

questions.question_text: A particle initially at rest starts moving from reference point $x=0$ along $x$-axis, with velocity $v$ that varies as $v=4 \sqrt{x} \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$. The acceleration of the particle is __________ $\mathrm{ms}^{-2}$.

questions.question_text:
Suppose a uniformly charged wall provides a uniform electric field of $2 \times 10^4 \mathrm{~N} / \mathrm{C}$ normally. A charged particle of mass $2 \mathrm{~g}$ being suspended through a silk thread of length $20 \mathrm{~cm}$ and remain stayed at a distance of $10 \mathrm{~cm}$ from the wall. 

Then the charge on the particle will be $\frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \mu \mathrm{C}$ where $x=$ ___________ . [use $\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^2$ ]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Suppose a uniformly charged wall provides a uniform electric field of $2 \times 10^4 \mathrm{~N} / \mathrm{C}$ normally. A charged particle of mass $2 \mathrm{~g}$ being suspended through a silk thread of length $20 \mathrm{~cm}$ and remain stayed at a distance of $10 \mathrm{~cm}$ from the wall. Then the charge on the particle will be $\frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \mu \mathrm{C}$ where $x=$ ___________ . [use $\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}^2$ ]

questions.question_text: A moving coil galvanometer has 100 turns and each turn has an area of $2.0 \mathrm{~cm}^2$. The magnetic field produced by the magnet is $0.01 \mathrm{~T}$ and the deflection in the coil is 0.05 radian when a current of $10 \mathrm{~mA}$ is passed through it. The torsional constant of the suspension wire is $x \times 10^{-5} \mathrm{~N}-\mathrm{m} / \mathrm{rad}$. The value of $x$ is _______ .
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A moving coil galvanometer has 100 turns and each turn has an area of $2.0 \mathrm{~cm}^2$. The magnetic field produced by the magnet is $0.01 \mathrm{~T}$ and the deflection in the coil is 0.05 radian when a current of $10 \mathrm{~mA}$ is passed through it. The torsional constant of the suspension wire is $x \times 10^{-5} \mathrm{~N}-\mathrm{m} / \mathrm{rad}$. The value of $x$ is _______ .

questions.question_text:
One end of a metal wire is fixed to a ceiling and a load of $2 \mathrm{~kg}$ hangs from the other end. A similar wire is attached to the bottom of the load and another load of $1 \mathrm{~kg}$ hangs from this lower wire. Then the ratio of longitudinal strain of upper wire to that of the lower wire will be ________.

 [Area of cross section of wire $=0.005 \mathrm{~cm}^2, \mathrm{Y}=2 \times 10^{11} \mathrm{Nm}^{-2}$ and $\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}$ ]
questions.subject: Physics

Then the ratio of longitudinal strain of upper wire to that of the lower wire will be ________. [Area of cross section of wire $=0.005 \mathrm{~cm}^2, \mathrm{Y}=2 \times 10^{11} \mathrm{Nm}^{-2}$ and $\mathrm{g}=10 \mathrm{~ms}^{-2}$ ]

questions.question_text: In Young's double slit experiment, monochromatic light of wavelength 5000 Å is used. The slits are $1.0 \mathrm{~mm}$ apart and screen is placed at $1.0 \mathrm{~m}$ away from slits. The distance from the centre of the screen where intensity becomes half of the maximum intensity for the first time is _________ $\times 10^{-6}$ $\mathrm{m}$.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: A coil of 200 turns and area $0.20 \mathrm{~m}^2$ is rotated at half a revolution per second and is placed in uniform magnetic field of $0.01 \mathrm{~T}$ perpendicular to axis of rotation of the coil. The maximum voltage generated in the coil is $\frac{2 \pi}{\beta}$ volt. The value of $\beta$ is _______.
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: A uniform rod $A B$ of mass $2 \mathrm{~kg}$ and length $30 \mathrm{~cm}$ at rest on a smooth horizontal surface. An impulse of force $0.2 \mathrm{~Ns}$ is applied to end B. The time taken by the rod to turn through at right angles will be $\frac{\pi}{x} \mathrm{~s}$, where $x=$ _______ .
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: A particular hydrogen-like ion emits the radiation of frequency $3 \times 10^{15} \mathrm{~Hz}$ when it makes transition from $n=2$ to $n=1$. The frequency of radiation emitted in transition from $n=3$ to $n=1$ is $\frac{x}{9} \times 10^{15} \mathrm{~Hz}$, when $x=$ ________ .
questions.subject: Physics
